description: This graph represents the core functionality of a code analysis tool focused on managing interactions with code repositories and ensuring the Git environment is correctly set up. The main flow involves a `Repository Manager` that handles repository operations, which in turn relies on a `Git Environment Checker` to validate the Git environment.

components.name: Repository Manager
components.description: Manages interactions with code repositories, including cloning, checking out specific versions, and handling temporary storage. It ensures the correct codebase is available for analysis. This component is fundamental for a code analysis tool as it directly handles the acquisition and preparation of the source code to be analyzed.

components.name: Git Environment Checker
components.description: Validates the presence, configuration, and readiness of the Git command-line tool and its associated environment. It acts as a gatekeeper, ensuring that all Git-dependent operations have the necessary prerequisites to execute successfully. This component is critical for the stability and reliability of any Git-dependent operations within the `Repository Manager`.
